meanings.definition: To cause a beam of light to change direction when it encounters an obstacle or passes through a narrow opening.
meanings.sent1: The prism was diffracting the sunlight into beautiful colors.
meanings.sent2: The glass marble diffracting the sunlight made a rainbow on the wall.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat enjoyed diffracting the laser pointer all around the room.
meanings.sent4: Her smile diffracted the gloomy atmosphere in the room, bringing warmth to everyone.
meanings.sent5: The magician's wand seemed to be diffracting the light, creating a mesmerizing illusion.
